text.0: strong rapturous joy praise glory are with indra impetuous god he quaffs the juice of soma.
text.1: that maghavan whom men must laud with singing heavendweller king of songs whose help is lasting.
text.2: he friend of man most wise victorious hero hears with farreaching aid the singer call him.
text.3: excellent praise of men the bards supporter strong he gives strength extolled in holy synod.
text.4: the lofty axle of thy wheels o hero is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness.
text.5: like branches of a tree invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee o indra.
text.6: strong lord thine energies endowed with vigour are like the paths of kine converging homeward.
text.7: like bonds of cord indra that bind the younglings no bonds are they o thou of boundless bounty.
text.8: one act today another act tomorrow oft indra makes what is not yet existeni.
text.9: here have we mitra varuṇa and pūṣan to overcome the foemans domination.
text.10: by song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee as from a mountains ridge o indra.
text.11: urging thy might with these fair lauds they seek thee o theme of song as horses rush tobattle.
text.12: that indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age nor fleeting days enfeeble.
text.13: still may his body wax een now so mighty glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.
text.14: extolled he bends not to the strong the steadfast nor to the bold incited by the dasyu.
text.15: high mountains are as level plains to indra even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.
text.16: impetuous speeder through all depth and distance give strengthening food thou drinker of the juices.
text.17: stand up erect to help us unreluctant what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.
text.18: hasting to help come hither and protect him keep him from harm when he is here o indra.
text.19: at home abroad from injury preserve him may brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
